qas.question: How many people died when the Valencia metro derailed?
When did the Valencia metro derail?
Who said the Valencia derailment was fortuitous?

answers.text: Vicente Rambla and Mayor Rita Barberá

qas.question: On which Valencia metro line did the derailment occur?
How many people were gravely injured by the derailment?

context: The Valencia Metro derailment occurred on <a1_0>3 July 2006<a1_0/> at 1 pm. CEST (1100 UTC) between Jesús and Plaça d'Espanya stations on Line <a3_0>1<a3_0/> of the Metrovalencia mass transit system. <a0_0>43<a0_0/> people were killed and <a4_0>more than ten<a4_0/> were seriously injured. It was not immediately clear what caused the crash. Both the Valencian government spokesman <a2_0>Vicente Rambla and Mayor Rita Barberá<a2_0/> called the accident a "fortuitous" event. However, the trade union CC.OO. accused the authorities of "rushing" to say anything but admit that Line 1 is in a state of "constant deterioration" with a "failure to carry out maintenance".
